newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada Aug manufacturers' shipments fall 0.7 pct.
newsitem.headline: Canada Aug manufacturers' shipments fall 0.7 pct.

text.p: Canadian manufacturers' shipments fell 0.7 percent in August to C$34.02 billion seasonally adjusted from a downwardly revised C$34.25 billion in July, Statistics Canada said on Wednesday.
A Reuters survey of economists had forecast shipments to rise 0.6 percent, unfilled orders to rise 0.4 percent, new orders to rise 0.8 percent and an inventory/shipment ratio of 1.29.
Statistics Canada said declines in the electrical and electronic product and the motor vehicle and parts industries were the main factors behind the drop in shipments in August.
The decline in shipments came together with a slight increase in inventories, the first since March, the agency said.

But with the strong gains in shipments in May and July, manufacturers' shipments in the last four months were 4.0 percent higher than in the "no-growth" first four months of the year, Statistics Canada said.
(For more information from Statistics Canada, contact Robert Traversy, Information and Classification Section at 613-951-9832.)
